data.title: Halle Berry's Husbands, Boyfriends, And Relationships
data.meta_description: Delve into the captivating love chronicles of Oscar-winning actress Halle Berry, as we explore her intriguing list of former flames. Our editors have combed ...
data.text:
Halle Berry first confirmed her relationship with singer Van Hunt by posting a photo of herself wearing a shirt with his name on it, along with the caption, "now ya know..."

In December 2021, Berry told peers at the 4th Annual Celebration of Black Cinema & Television event that he was the "love of her life."

“You’ve watched me fail and fail and fail and fail. Besides directing my first movie, I also found the love of my life, and I know it’s true and this is how I know it’s true. Because you fail so many times, you know what wrong looks like. And because I failed so many times, I now know what [love] really looks like," Berry said.

Van Hunt is a celebrated American musician, singer, and songwriter. He garnered fame with his eponymous debut album in 2004 which earned him a Grammy in 2007 for Best R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals. His music encompasses elements of funk, blues, and soul, giving him a unique sound and a devoted following in the music industry.

Halle Berry and Grammy-nominated music producer Alex da Kid were first spotted together in September 2017 at a romantic dinner in London. It wasn't until later, in November 2017, that Berry confirmed their relationship via Instagram. The relationship ended up being a brief one, with reports claiming they ended things in December of the same year.

Alexander Grant, professionally known as Alex da Kid, is a popular music producer and songwriter from England. He has produced several hit tracks for artists like Eminem, Rihanna, Nicki Minaj, and Imagine Dragons, among others. He is renowned for integrating various genres into his music, solidifying his standing as a significant figure in the music industry.

Berry's relationship with French actor Olivier Martinez started back in 2010 when they fell in love while filming the movie Dark Tide in South Africa. They got engaged in 2012 and married in July 2013 in France. Their son, Maceo, was born the same year in October. However, the couple decided to end their marriage in 2015 and got officially divorced in 2016.

Olivier Martinez is a highly regarded French film actor known for his roles in films like Unfaithful, Before Night Falls, and Taking Lives. He won the Cesar award (the French equivalent of the Oscars) for "Most Promising Actor" for his performance in Un, Deux, Trois, Soleil in 1993. His rugged good looks and acting prowess have made him a desired figure in both the French and American movie industry.

The Canadian model, Gabriel Aubry, and Halle Berry started dating in November 2005 after they met at a Versace photoshoot. Their relationship was highlighted by the birth of their daughter Nahla in 2008. However, the couple split in April 2010 after almost five years together. Their breakup was followed by a lengthy child custody battle over their daughter.

Gabriel Aubry is a Canadian model who has been the face of many reputable fashion brands such as Tommy Hilfiger, Calvin Klein, and Karl Lagerfeld. His high-profile relationship with Halle Berry further brought him to the limelight, and he continues to be one of the respected figures in the modeling industry.

Halle Berry and Michael Ealy first crossed paths on the set of Their Eyes Were Watching God, an American Broadcasting Company television film, in 2004. Berry was drawn to Ealy's charming personality and acting talent, igniting a romance that would last for about two years. Although the couple was intensely private about the details of their relationship, their chemistry was undeniable, both on and off-screen. It wasn't long before fans began to speculate about the nature of their relationship, which they later confirmed was romantic.

Michael Ealy is an accomplished American actor notable for his performances in various Hollywood productions. His breakthrough came following his emotive portrayal of a reformed gang member in the drama Barbershop, which catapulted him into the limelight and cemented his reputation as a talented performer. From there, he continued to impress with successful roles in films like 2 Fast 2 Furious, Takers, and Think Like A Man.
